name: katal
text: A comment left by katal was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, sean1058, Vondicus, sevenarts, tim_simmons, TheLoneliestMonkey, NDCaesar, MortisInvictus, paulthasaw, ravindra108, midgetron)

name: hexjumper
text:
Note what Ray's dad said - they've been fighting together since they were little, Beef using brains, Ray using fists. It's not surprising that they would work together to get themselves out of this situation.

What is surprising is that it's Ray with the plan and Beef who's following along - maybe because Beef's smart, but not tactically smart.

name: jamers
text: Or practical with the common sense. Ray always has a plan of action.

name: stevegt500
text: Ray Smuckles: He Gets Things Done

name: phthoggos
text: It's not that. The GOF is sacred to Beef - he has been obsessed with it since oldest times. He's been dreaming about this moment all his life, which is how he got them this far. But that very dedication is what holds him back now - he's so immersed in GOF history that he can't even imagine going outside the parameters of the game. Only Ray -- who doesn't know "even like one sentence of information about the Fight" -- can transcend the system, "become the ruling body," and truly inherit his father's legacy.

name: spinynorman
text: I just think it's sorta cool to see two dudes I like beat the shit out of some guys, you know what I'm sayin?

name: saint
text: who better to throw down the Great Outdoor Fight than the Son of a legend, am I right?

name: i_love_kate
text: A comment left by i_love_kate was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by antecen, atticusonline, IrishGuy)

name: deusoma
text: That comment was fucking epic.

name: ttagxamm
text: And their success in the GOF is rooted in their natures: Roast Beef's the cautious, careful planner, with a born worrier's fretful attention to detail, while Ray's whole life is mostly a wild improvisation, and true to his bloodline, "noone said it could be done" is his idea of a perfect plan.

name: hyetal
text: This is quite possibly the most beautiful comment on all the Achewood boards.  It needs more chubbies.

name: duperando
text: agreed

name: spiderbethlehem
text: Throwin' another chubby on this fantastically well deserved pile. Man, an archives crawl is immeasurably improved by the scholars and gentlemen of the Achewood community.

name: hateandwar
text:
I pretty much gave you a chubby for your avatar. Mike Haggar is a King among men.

myspace.com/mayorhaggar

name: lizjones
text: I think it's a satisfying conclusion. Beef got them through the fight and Ray got them out.

name: peppermint
text: A comment left by peppermint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Sakana, redion, waitwhat, STUART)

name: redion
text: argh, my hand slipped! sorry for the lame.

name: cleave
text:
I think you're forgetting though that these are dire circumstances. Remember that "abnormal reaction to abnormal circumstance is normal." It is difficult to predict or characterize how even well known associates will react in grim scenarios.

I agree with you; they are not acting like themselves. But I also think that they are in some crazy times right now and that they area just playing accordingly.

name: methadone
text: ray got alot more backbone in the GOF, he's taking charge

name: theloneliestmonkey
text: The only time I jumped up out of my seat and cheered at a comic strip.

name: dougthehead
text:
"We gonna make the metals kiss and the fuel turn lively." One of the best lines in Achewood, ever.

And yeah, this storyline doesn't really go against the character because the characters aren't static- They gradually change over time as different things happen.

name: falseprophet
text: Rage Against The Machine needs to get back together and make that the first line of their album.

name: nickb285
text: This line is probably my favorite sentence ever written, anywhere. Even out of context, it's oddly poetic and vaguely badass.

name: fourninefoxtrot
text:
Yes.

This is an underrated line, lost against the backdrop of the epic Jeep action.

Just so might Oppenheimer's "I have become death, the Destroyer of Worlds", quoting from the Bhagavad Gita during the testing of the first nuclear bombs, have become forgotten were there no one there to hear and remember.

name: malesherbez
text: so I guess it's just the little skull on the front that caught fire?

name: senseihollywood
text:
if you listen closely you can hear it:

"Bela Luugoiiiiissss...deaaaaaddddddduuuhhhhhhh"

name: senseihollywood
text:
Beef is hell of book smart.
Ray gets things done.

name: wehavemagnums
text: Ray's whipping up a new batch of sauce in panel 6.

name: andyfaewatford
text: Panel six is perfect. SO perfect. If I had had drawn that I would have used it a hell of a lot more than twice.

name: tinhand
text: Yeah the ape-shit craziness of panel 6 definitely makes it for me. "crak".

name: i_love_kate
text:
"You gonna stand there with your butt on the back of your body?!"

Wins.

name: saru
text: I was just wondering why nobody mentioned this awesome line. I guess the rocksomeness of the rest of the strip pushed that to the back burner.

name: gyrate
text: I live for the day I can use this line in casual conversation.

name: i_love_kate
text: Ray has an invisible leg in the last panel.

name: joamiq
text: There's just something in between Ray and the gas.

name: i_love_kate
text: Whoa. Crazy perspective changing, there. You just blew my mind a little.

name: drago25
text: Man, Ray could even give Logan a run for his money for going all Beserker-style on dudes.

name: sparhawk
text:
Logan all standing there with his ass on the back of his body...

Ray's two-pawed punching style is win.

name: direhaggis
text: Damn this strip gives me a giddy Mad Max with ass-kicking cats feel.

name: panopticism
text: greatest story arc ever? methinks so.

name: troy_convers
text: Hard Travelling heroes

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
translation of Beef's line:
"THEY MUFT SIZZLE"

name: carlyle
text: Promising to make "the metals kiss and the fuel turn lively" is fucking Shakespeare. God, I love that line to death.

name: w_w
text: What do you suppose the drivers in the other two jeeps were doing while Ray staved on their buddy?
